intro: Lannea nana, commonly known as the dwarf lannea, is a small shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants like the cashew and poison ivy. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are yellow when mature. Lannea nana is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
